snippet: Officers were 75 percent more likely to stop black motorists than white motorists, according to the state attorney general.
abstract: Office of Missouri Atty Gen Chris Koster releases report on 2014 traffic stops showing that police officers in state were 75 percent more likely to stop black drivers than white drivers, and 73 percent more likely to search those black drivers.
lead_paragraph: Officers were 75 percent more likely to stop black motorists than white motorists, according to the state attorney general.

headline.main: Missouri Reports Wide Racial Disparity in Traffic Stops
headline.print_headline: Big Disparity for Blacks Pulled Over in Missouri
